body:
IncludesValueImpl / IncludesValueFastPath - src/objects/elements.cc
Preconditions/guards snippet:
- Checks receiver is JSObject with fast elements (fast-path selection in caller).
- Uses start_from/index and length; bounds checks performed by caller.
- If elements are simple (packed/holey) use IncludesValueFastPath which:
  - Iterates elements with Unsafe loads (LoadFixedArrayElement / LoadFixedDoubleArrayElement)
  - Compares via Object::SameValueZero(*value, *element_k) and treats holes per elements kind
  - For holey kinds, treats hole as absent unless includes semantics (holes→undefined) handled
- Falls back to IncludesValueSlowPath on dictionary, slow kinds or when SameValueZero requires runtime (BigInt/String compare)
Explanation: Implements the core fast and slow element search for JS arrays; SameValueZero comparisons and hole handling are done here; used by ArrayIncludes runtime and builtins.
explanation: Core array elements Includes implementation: fast-path loops using Unsafe loads, SameValueZero comparisons (NaN handling), hole treatment, and slow fallbacks. This is the canonical C++ behavior behind the builtins' generated specialized TF stubs.
